name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
tweet: Sun tables for today show slightly more than 12 hours of daylight.  Light bends on entering Earth‚Äôs atmosphere from space. The sunrise or sunset you see is the lagged location of the Sun‚Äôs refracted light, and not the the Sun itself, adding unearned minutes of daylight ‚Äî daily.  https://t.co/iUv19Jn6OB

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
tweet: @TheWhiskyMaker @symbolium @RichardCheese Caused by the refraction of sunlight entering Earth‚Äôs atmosphere from space.  Also, sunrise times reference a different spot on the Sun than sunset times.  Combined, they add multiple minutes of daylight that wouldn't otherwise be there.

name: Neil deGrasse Tyson
tweet: Merry Equinox to all residents of planet Earth. On this day, Earth‚Äôs tilted axis points neither towards nor away from the Sun.  Astronomically, that gives us Spring north of the equator, and Autumn south of it.  Also 12 hours of daylight and 12 hours of nighttime - worldwide.
